trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> object that is accessed through the intrinsic <xref href="System.Web.HttpResponse"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse.Write%2A> methods of the intrinsic <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse> object make internal calls to an HttpWriter object.
Sends all buffered output to the HTTP output stream and closes the socket connection.
Gets an <xref:System.Text.Encoding> object for the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter>.
An instance of the <xref:System.Text.Encoding> class indicating the character set of the current response.
Sends all buffered output to the HTTP output stream.
Gets a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object to enable HTTP output directly from the <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
An instance of the <xref:System.IO.Stream> class containing the data to send to the client
Sends a single character to the HTTP output stream.
The character to send to the HTTP output stream.
Sends an <xref:System.Object> to the HTTP output stream.
The <xref:System.Object> to send to the HTTP output stream.
Sends a string to the HTTP output stream.
The string to send to the HTTP output stream.
Sends a stream of characters with the specified starting position and number of characters to the HTTP output stream.
The memory buffer containing the characters to send to the HTTP output stream
The buffer position of the first character to send.
The number of characters to send beginning at the position specified by `index`.
Sends a stream of bytes with the specified starting position and number of bytes to the HTTP output stream.
The memory buffer containing the bytes to send to the HTTP output stream.
The buffer position of the first byte to send.
The number of bytes to send, beginning at the byte position specified by `index`.
Sends a carriage return + line feed (CRLF) pair of characters to the HTTP output stream.
Sends a string with the specified starting position and number of characters to the HTTP output stream.
The string to send to the HTTP output stream.
The character position of the first byte to send.
The number of characters to send, beginning at the character position specified by `index`.
